thread.title: Deborah Hurwitz
thread.title_full: Frames Direct reviewed by Deborah Hurwitz

author: Deborah Hurwitz
title: Deborah Hurwitz
text: I recently went to the optometrist for a check-up and new glasses prescription, and shopped in the store for frames. Found a super cute Tory Burch designer pair for about $200 - pricey but not astronomical. But by the time they added up the progressive lenses, the anti-glare, all the bells and whistles - just over $800!! No way! Someone told me that you could order prescription glasses with designer frames online, so I starting Googling and came up with Frames Direct. In less than ten minutes I had the exact frames and lenses picked out that I'd chosen at the store, took a picture of my Rx and emailed it, and my order was on its way. It took about two weeks for them to arrive but I wasn't in a rush. Total price tag: $320. So happy!
